Download the March 2006 Edition of the ProLibertad Newsletter El Coqui
Libre:http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclMarch2006.pdf
______________________________________________________________________________

This Digest contains:

1.  Friday March 24th: Despierta Boricua Segment Break Down

2.  Friday April 7th: Our Women, Our Struggle Documentary Screening

3.  Monday April 17th: International Night for Political Prisoners

4. April 25th: Freedom Now!! The Cases of the Puerto Rican and Cuban 
Political Prisoners
(YOUTH EVENT)
______________________________________________________________________________

Despierta Boricua is a fifteen minute Radio segment produced for WBAI 99.5
FM Friday Morning Wake UP Call by The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign.
Despierta Boricua airs at 6:45am every Friday; Despierta Boricua is
dedicated to providing our listening audience with the latest news/updates
on Puerto Rican politics/culture from throughout the Puerto Rican Diaspora
and Puerto Rico.

This week's segment, Friday March 24th, will feature an interview with Ramon
Jimenez about the 30th anniversary of the Hostos Community College Take
over.  On March 25th 1976, a coalition of Students, Professors, and
Community activists took over Hostos Community College (H.C.C.). The 23 days
that followed, (longest College take over in history) set the stage for a
multi tactical campaign that saved the institution from the planned closure.
This is one of the most successful campaigns in our community�s history and
as a result 30 years later presently, HCC continues to provide bi-lingual
education to the Spanish speaking migrant & immigrant community.

If you aren't in New York you can listen via webstream at:
http://www.wbai.org
_______________________________________________________________________________

DOCUMENTARY FUNDRAISER
FILM Our Women, Our struggle
BY: MELISSA MONTERO, The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign

SAVE THE DATE: APRIL 7TH, 2006

Hello Everyone:

I will be having a fundraiser for my documentary Our Women, Our struggle,
which will be a compelling hour-long documentary that chronicles the lives
of four Puerto Rican women activists -- Isabel Rosado, Lolita Lebron, Dylcia
Pagan, and Esperanza Martell, who dedicated their lives to ending social
injustice. Collectively these women will speak on the historical struggle of
Puerto Rican Independence while also sharing their contributions to the
movement.�

WHERE: TEATRO LA TEA
107 SUFFOLK ST.
CLEMENTE SOTO VELEZ CULTURAL CENTER
DATE: APRIL 7, 2006
TIME: 7-10:30PM
ENTRANCE: $20

�PERFORMANCES
�SNACKS AND APPETIZERS INCLUDED
�SCREENING 10 MINUTE TRAILER

by going to www.wmm.com

Click on “for filmmakers”, then go to sponsored projects, click on the
letter O and then you will see my project with a short description and a
picture.

You are Invited to a Celebration for International Political Prisoners
Monday, April 17, 2006
Reception: 6:30 to 7 � Program: 7 to 10 p.m.
Hunter College West Building Room 217
(68th St. & Lexington Ave. off the 6 train)

Videos & Speakers:
Ashanti Alston: Jericho Movement
Toni: Leonard Peltier Defense Committee
Frank Velgara: ProLibertad,
Lawyer: International PP Work,
Representative from the MOVE Org.,
Representative from Al-Awda
& others to be announced

Cultural Presentation:
by Tre�Dee and T. Hayes El of Collective Flow
Photo Exhibit of International Political Prisoners

Donation: Only $5! All proceeds to help the prisoners

For more information, call: 718-220-6004 and 718-601-4751
nycjericho@...; ProLibertad@...

______________________________________________________________________________

FREEDOM NOW!!
The Cases of the Puerto Rican and Cuban Political Prisoners

DID YOU KNOW THAT THE U.S. GOVERNMENT WILL JAIL YOU FOR FIGHTING AGAINST 
TERRORISM?

DID YOU KNOW PUERTO RICO HAS BEEN A COLONY FOR 107 YEARS?

Join us for an afternoon discussion on U.S. foreign policy with Cuba and 
Puerto Rico.

Also, learn about the Puerto Rican and Cuban political prisoners!!  These 
NINE REVOLUTIONARIES have been jailed by the U.S. government for fighting 
for justice and freedom!!

Come and learn how you can join the international movement to free these 
political prisoners!!

Tues. April 25th 5-7pm
NYU Kimmel Student
Center 60 Washington Sq South  Room 805
(Btwn. Laguardia Place and Thompson)

A reception will follow with FOOD

This event is brought to you by The Hispanic Scholarship Fund,
LUCHA, ProLibertad and the Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5.

A reception will follow with FOOD

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:4053
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2006-03-26 18:23:33
Subject:FREEDOM MONTH APRIL 2006!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
ProLibertad@...
http://www.ProLibertadweb.com
ProLibertad Hotline: 718-601 4751
_______________________________________________________________________________

Download the March 2006 Edition of the ProLibertad Newsletter El Coqui
Libre:http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclMarch2006.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

In commemoration of the 26th anniversary of a series of arrests that began 
on April 4th, 1980, ProLibertad has dedicated the month of April to the 
Puerto Rican Political Prisoners; we call it FREEDOM MONTH!!  This month is 
full of activities and events to raise awareness about the Puerto Rican 
Political Prisoners and to inspire people to join the movement to free our 
Freedom fighters!!

We freed the Nationalists in the 1970s!! We freed some of the prisoners in 
1999!!  We can make freedom happen again!!  JOIN THE MOVEMENT!!

WE CANNOT FORGET OUR PRISONERS!! OSCAR LOPEZ RIVERA, CARLOS ALBNERTO TORRES 
AND HAYDEE BELTRAN PRESENTE!!

SOME HISTORY:
Starting on April 4th, 1980, fourteen people accused of being members of the 
Armed Forces of National Liberation (FALN, its acronym in Spanish) were 
arrested. At the time of their arrest they declared themselves to be 
combatants in an anti-colonial war to liberate Puerto Rico from U.S. 
domination and invoked prisoner of war status.

They argued that the U.S. courts and its political subdivisions did not have 
jurisdiction to try them as criminals and petitioned for their cases to be 
handed over to an international, impartial court that would determine their 
status. The U.S. government did not recognize their request.  These brothers 
and sisters became the first crop of Puerto Rican Political Prisoners to be 
incarcerated in the 1980s; to be followed by several members of Los 
Macheteros in 1985.

In Sept. 1999, President William Clinton granted several of the Puerto Rican 
Political Prisoners clemency, but three of these compa�er@s are still in 
prison.  They are Oscar Lopez Rivera, Haydee Beltran Torres, and Carlos 
Alberto Torres!!

For the past 26 years, the international community has called for their 
release!!  Join the millions of voices that cry out for freedom and 
justice!!  We need your talent, enthusiasm, creativity, organizing skills 
and your energy!!  Join ProLibertad!!  Contact us at ProLibertad@...
______________________________________________________________________________

FREEDOM MONTH CALENDAR:

Monday, April 17, 2006 Reception: 6:30 to 7 � Program: 7 to 10 p.m.
You are Invited to a Celebration for International Political Prisoners
Hunter College West Building Room 217
(68th St. & Lexington Ave. off the 6 train)

Videos & Speakers:
Ashanti Alston: Jericho Movement, Toni: Leonard Peltier Defense Committee, 
Frank Velgara: ProLibertad, Lawyer: International PP Work, Representative 
from the MOVE Org., Representative from Al-Awda & others to be announced

Cultural Presentation:
by Tre�Dee and T. Hayes El of Collective Flow
Photo Exhibit of International Political Prisoners

Donation: Only $5! All proceeds to help the prisoners

For more information, call: 718-220-6004 and 718-601-4751
nycjericho@...; ProLibertad@...
Sponsored by: NYC Jericho and ProLibertad
______________________________________________________________________________

PEOPLE'S MASS FOR THE PUERTO RICAN POLITICAL PRISONERS!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign and La Iglesia San Romero De Las 
Americas/UCC welcome you to join us for a PEOPLE'S MASS dedicated to the 
Puerto Rican Political Prisoners.

Speakers:
Rev. Luis Barrios, LA Iglesia San Romero De Las Americas/UCC
Frank Velgara, ProLibertad

Sunday April 23, 2006 at 11:30am
La Iglesia san Romero De Las Americas/UCC
2410 Amsterdam Avenue 4th floor
(Between W179th-180th Sts.)
Take the 1 or 9 train to W181st and Broadway and then walk to Amsterdam Ave.
_______________________________________________________________________________

FREEDOM NOW!!  The Cases of the Puerto Rican and Cuban Political Prisoners

DID YOU KNOW THAT THE U.S. GOVERNMENT WILL JAIL YOU FOR FIGHTING AGAINST
TERRORISM?

DID YOU KNOW PUERTO RICO HAS BEEN A COLONY FOR 107 YEARS?

Join us for an afternoon discussion on U.S. foreign policy with Cuba and 
Puerto Rico.

Also, learn about the Puerto Rican and Cuban political prisoners!!  These
NINE REVOLUTIONARIES have been jailed by the U.S. government for fighting
for justice and freedom!!

Come and learn how you can join the international movement to free these
political prisoners!!

Tues. April 25th 5-7pm
NYU Kimmel Student
Center 60 Washington Sq South  Room 805
(Btwn. Laguardia Place and Thompson)

A reception will follow with FOOD

This event is brought to you by The Hispanic Scholarship Fund,
LUCHA, ProLibertad and the Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5.

In commemoration of the 26th anniversary of a series of arrests that began

Starting on April 4th, 1980, fourteen people accused of being members of the 
Armed Forces of National Liberation (FALN, its acronym in Spanish) were 
arrested. At the time of their arrest they declared themselves to be 
combatants in an anti-colonial war to liberate Puerto Rico from U.S.

They argued that the U.S. courts and its political subdivisions did not have

status. The U.S. government did not recognize their request.  These brothers 
and sisters became the first crop of Puerto Rican Political Prisoners to be 
incarcerated in the 1980s; to be followed by several members of Los 
Macheteros in 1985.

In Sept. 1999, President William Clinton granted several of the Puerto Rican

Post ID:4056
Sender:"Freethe5 Libertadparalos5" <freethecubanFIVE@...>
Post Date/Time:2006-03-27 13:48:41
Subject:Sign Cuban 5 Petition/April 25th Event
Message:

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5
http://www.freethecuban5.com
FreethecubanFIVE@...
Free the Cuban 5 Hotline: 718-601-4751

******************************************************************************
Download our February 2006 newsletter:
http://www.freethecuban5.com/JF5February2006.pdf

******************************************************************************
The Popular Education Project  to Free the Cuban 5 is calling on all freedom 
loving people to support this new initiative to grant the families of the 
Cuban 5 visas to visit them.

Due to the U.S. government's denial to approve visas,  Gerardo Hernandez 
Nordelo's wife and daughter have not seen him in six years.  Also, Rene 
Gonzalez Sehwerert has not seen his wife and daughter in 4 years.  Others in 
the Cuban 5 have not seen their parents, wives and children with regularity, 
because the U.S. government has taken prolonged periods of time to issue 
them visas.

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5 needs your help in 
pressuring Louise Arbour, the High Commissioner of Human Rights of the 
United Nations Office of Geneva, so she can intercede in this matter and 
request the U.S. government grant visas to the family members of the Cuban 
5.

We need you to sign the petition below and to mail out a letter to Luoise 
Arbour!!

SIGN THE FOLLOWING PETITION: 
http://www.petitiononline.com/Cuban5/petition.html

Download our letter to Louise Arbour and MAKE SURE TO MAIL IT TO THE ADDRESS
ON THE TOP OF THE LETTER.  MIALING IT IS IMPORTANT!! IT HELPS SHOW THAT
THERE MANY PEOPLE IN SUPPORT OF THIS CAMPAIGN:

http://www.freethecuban5.com/PEPLetterGeneva.pdf

PLEASE FORWARD THIS TO EVERYONE IN YOUR ADDRESS BOX!!  THE CUBAN 5 NEED US
TO BUILD THIS MASS MOVEMENT!!

*******************************************************************************

Tues. April 25th, 2006 5-7pm
FREEDOM NOW!! The Cases of the Puerto Rican and Cuban Political Prisoners

NYU Kimmel Student Center
60 Washington Sq South Room 805 (Btwn. Laguardia Place and Thompson)

DID YOU KNOW THAT THE U.S. GOVERNMENT WILL JAIL YOU FOR FIGHTING AGAINST 
TERRORISM?

DID YOU KNOW PUERTO RICO HAS BEEN A COLONY FOR 107 YEARS?

Join us for an afternoon discussion on U.S.foreign policy with Cuba and 
Puerto Rico. Also, learn about the Puerto Rican and Cuban political 
prisoners!! These NINE REVOLUTIONARIES have been jailed by the U.S. 
government for fighting for justice and freedom!!

Come and learn how you can join the international movement to free these 
political prisoners!!

A reception will follow with FOOD This event is brought to you by The 
Hispanic Scholarship Fund, LUCHA, ProLibertad and the Popular Education 
Project to Free the Cuban 5

Post ID:4061
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2006-03-29 07:09:16
Subject:FBI ARREST ANTONIO CAMACHO NEGRON!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
ProLibertad@...
http://www.ProLibertadweb.com
ProLibertad Hotline: 718-601 4751
_______________________________________________________________________________

Download the March 2006 Edition of the ProLibertad Newsletter El Coqui
Libre:http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclMarch2006.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

ANTONIO CAMACHO NEGRON HAS BEEN ARRESTED BY THE FBI!!
EMERGENCY PICKET FRIDAY MARCH 31ST 5PM 26 FEDERAL PLAZA

As hearings on FBI repression and abuse in Puerto Rico were taking place in 
Washington DC, Antonio camacho Negron was arrested by the FBI for violating 
the conditions of his parole; conditions he has never acknowledged.

Arrested on Tuesday March 28th, during the openingmeeting of the CONADE 
(Comite Nacional De Descolonizacion) a national movement for de-colonization 
Camacho Negron has been key in developing in Puerto Rico.

This is another attempt by the FBI to intimidate and destablize the Puerto 
Rican independence movement.

COME OUT ON FRIDAY MARCH 31ST AT 5PM AND EXPRESS YOUR RAGE!!

FBI ASESINOS-FUERA FBI DE PUERTO RICO!!
FREE PUERTO RICO!!
FREE THE PUERTO RICAN POLITICAL PRISONERS!!

Detenido el ex l�der de los macheteros Antonio Camacho
Mi�rcoles, 29 de marzo de 2006
Por Daniel Rivera Vargas
End.drivera@...

Justo el d�a en que se celebraban vistas congresionales sobre supuestos 
abusos en las intervenciones recientes del Negociado Federal de 
Investigaciones (FBI, por sus siglas en ingl�s) en Puerto Rico, agentes de 
esa agencia arrestaron ayer al ex l�der machetero Antonio Camacho Negr�n.
�Fue arrestado hoy (ayer) por la tarde por agentes del FBI sin incidentes�, 
dijo Harry Rodr�guez, portavoz del Negociado.

Explic� que Camacho Negr�n, un yaucano de 65 a�os de edad, fue arrestado 
entre las 4:00 y 4:30 p.m. de ayer en San Juan por violar los t�rminos de su 
libertad condicional.
En una audiencia congresional se discut�an ayer alegados excesos del FBI 
durante el operativo de septiembre en que el jefe m�ximo de Los Macheteros, 
Filiberto Ojeda R�os result� muerto, y el incidente en que agentes federales 
rociaron gas pimienta y empujaron a periodistas durante uno de los 
allanamientos a independentistas supuestamente vinculados a este grupo 
clandestino, en febrero pasado.

Los rumores de su inminente arresto circulaban desde hace tiempo y en 
expresiones publicadas en un portal de Internet en octubre de 2005, Camacho 
Negr�n dijo: �El FBI est� interesado en secuestrarme por informaci�n que yo 
he recopilado relacionada a la muerte de Filiberto�.

La informaci�n en poder de Rodr�guez ayer era que la presunta violaci�n a 
los t�rminos de libertad condicional por el independentista se cometi� el 20 
de agosto de 2004, hace a�o y medio. No se explic� por qu� fue hasta ayer 
que detuvieron a Camacho Negr�n, cuando era visto p�blicamente en 
actividades masivas incluso frente a la Corte Federal.

Camacho Negr�n fue encarcelado anoche en el Centro Metropolitano de 
Denuncias de Guaynabo, mejor conocida como la c�rcel federal. El l�der 
machetero tiene derecho a una vista ante la Junta federal de Libertad 
Condicional en la que puede estar representado por abogados y llevar 
testigos, se indic�.

Camacho Negr�n sali� en probatoria el 17 de agosto de 2004 tras una d�cada 
cumpliendo c�rcel por conspirar para transportar dinero robado, relacionado 
al robo de $7.2 millones a un dep�sito de la Wells Fargo, que el Ej�rcito 
Popular Boricua-Los Macheteros llev� a cabo en 1983, en Connecticut.
Es la tercera vez que arrestan a Camacho Negr�n, dijo Rodr�guez. La primera 
por el robo al cami�n, la segunda por violar por primera vez sus condiciones 
de libertad y ayer la tercera.

ANTONIO CAMACHO NEGRON HAS BEEN ARRESTED BY THE FBI!!
EMERGENCY PICKET FRIDAY MARCH 31ST 5PM 26 FEDERAL PLAZA

As hearings on FBI repression and abuse in Puerto Rico were taking place in 
Washington DC, Antonio camacho Negron was arrested by the FBI for violating 
the conditions of his parole; conditions he has never acknowledged.

Arrested on Tuesday March 28th, during the openingmeeting of the CONADE 
(Comite Nacional De Descolonizacion) a national movement for de-colonization 
Camacho Negron has been key in developing in Puerto Rico.

This is another attempt by the FBI to intimidate and destablize the Puerto 
Rican independence movement.

COME OUT ON FRIDAY MARCH 31ST AT 5PM AND EXPRESS YOUR RAGE!!

FBI ASESINOS-FUERA FBI DE PUERTO RICO!!

ANTONIO CAMACHO NEGRON HAS BEEN ARRESTED BY THE FBI!!
EMERGENCY PICKET FRIDAY MARCH 31ST 5PM 26 FEDERAL PLAZA

As hearings on FBI repression and abuse in Puerto Rico were taking place in
Washington DC, Antonio camacho Negron was arrested by the FBI for violating
the conditions of his parole; conditions he has never acknowledged.

Arrested on Tuesday March 28th, during the openingmeeting of the CONADE
(Comite Nacional De Descolonizacion) a national movement for de-colonization
Camacho Negron has been key in developing in Puerto Rico.

This is another attempt by the FBI to intimidate and destablize the Puerto
Rican independence movement.

COME OUT ON FRIDAY MARCH 31ST AT 5PM AND EXPRESS YOUR RAGE!!

FBI ASESINOS-FUERA FBI DE PUERTO RICO!!
FREE PUERTO RICO!!
FREE THE PUERTO RICAN POLITICAL PRISONERS!!
_______________________________________________________________________________


Detenido el ex lder de los macheteros Antonio Camacho
Mircoles, 29 de marzo de 2006
Por Daniel Rivera Vargas
End.drivera@elnuevodia.com<http://groups.yahoo.com/group/PROLIBERTAD/post?postID=NRRWS0-8cCuPubyyV_noqu5yIdccZVQ9DbkyKVFdWqokyjBZzDs3CBimt3Qvg7Q_xuFaNZW5_vj8_9EEFv8una_y>

Justo el da en que se celebraban vistas congresionales sobre supuestos
abusos en las intervenciones recientes del Negociado Federal de
Investigaciones (FBI, por sus siglas en ingls) en Puerto Rico, agentes de
esa agencia arrestaron ayer al ex lder machetero Antonio Camacho Negrn.
"Fue arrestado hoy (ayer) por la tarde por agentes del FBI sin incidentes",
dijo Harry Rodrguez, portavoz del Negociado.

Explic que Camacho Negrn, un yaucano de 65 aos de edad, fue arrestado
entre las 4:00 y 4:30 p.m. de ayer en San Juan por violar los trminos de su
libertad condicional.

En una audiencia congresional se discutan ayer alegados excesos del FBI
durante el operativo de septiembre en que el jefe mximo de Los Macheteros,
Filiberto Ojeda Ros result muerto, y el incidente en que agentes federales

rociaron gas pimienta y empujaron a periodistas durante uno de los
allanamientos a independentistas supuestamente vinculados a este grupo
clandestino, en febrero pasado.

Los rumores de su inminente arresto circulaban desde hace tiempo y en
expresiones publicadas en un portal de Internet en octubre de 2005, Camacho
Negrn dijo: "El FBI est interesado en secuestrarme por informacin que yo
he recopilado relacionada a la muerte de Filiberto".

La informacin en poder de Rodrguez ayer era que la presunta violacin a
los trminos de libertad condicional por el independentista se cometi el 20
de agosto de 2004, hace ao y medio. No se explic por qu fue hasta ayer
que detuvieron a Camacho Negrn, cuando era visto pblicamente en
actividades masivas incluso frente a la Corte Federal.

Camacho Negrn fue encarcelado anoche en el Centro Metropolitano de
Denuncias de Guaynabo, mejor conocida como la crcel federal. El lder
machetero tiene derecho a una vista ante la Junta federal de Libertad
Condicional en la que puede estar representado por abogados y llevar
testigos, se indic.

Camacho Negrn sali en probatoria el 17 de agosto de 2004 tras una dcada
cumpliendo crcel por conspirar para transportar dinero robado, relacionado
al robo de $7.2 millones a un depsito de la Wells Fargo, que el Ejrcito
Popular Boricua-Los Macheteros llev a cabo en 1983, en Connecticut.
Es la tercera vez que arrestan a Camacho Negrn, dijo Rodrguez. La primera
por el robo al camin, la segunda por violar por primera vez sus condiciones
de libertad y ayer la tercera.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

ANTONIO CAMACHO NEGRON HAS BEEN ARRESTED BY THE FBI!!
EMERGENCY PICKET FRIDAY MARCH 31ST 5PM 26 FEDERAL PLAZA

As hearings on FBI repression and abuse in Puerto Rico were taking place in
Washington DC, Antonio camacho Negron was arrested by the FBI for violating
the conditions of his parole; conditions he has never acknowledged.

Arrested on Tuesday March 28th, during the openingmeeting of the CONADE
(Comite Nacional De Descolonizacion) a national movement for de-colonization
Camacho Negron has been key in developing in Puerto Rico.

This is another attempt by the FBI to intimidate and destablize the Puerto
Rican independence movement.

COME OUT ON FRIDAY MARCH 31ST AT 5PM AND EXPRESS YOUR RAGE!!

FBI ASESINOS-FUERA FBI DE PUERTO RICO!!
FREE PUERTO RICO!!
FREE THE PUERTO RICAN POLITICAL PRISONERS!!
_______________________________________________________________________________


Detenido el ex lder de los macheteros Antonio Camacho
Mircoles, 29 de marzo de 2006
Por Daniel Rivera Vargas
End.drivera@...m<http://groups.yahoo.com/group/PROLIBERTAD/post?postID=NRRWS0-8cCuPubyyV_noqu5yIdccZVQ9DbkyKVFdWqokyjBZzDs3CBimt3Qvg7Q_xuFaNZW5_vj8_9EEFv8una_y>

Justo el da en que se celebraban vistas congresionales sobre supuestos
abusos en las intervenciones recientes del Negociado Federal de
Investigaciones (FBI, por sus siglas en ingls) en Puerto Rico, agentes de
esa agencia arrestaron ayer al ex lder machetero Antonio Camacho Negrn.
"Fue arrestado hoy (ayer) por la tarde por agentes del FBI sin incidentes",
dijo Harry Rodrguez, portavoz del Negociado.

Explic que Camacho Negrn, un yaucano de 65 aos de edad, fue arrestado
entre las 4:00 y 4:30 p.m. de ayer en San Juan por violar los trminos de su
libertad condicional.

En una audiencia congresional se discutan ayer alegados excesos del FBI
durante el operativo de septiembre en que el jefe mximo de Los Macheteros,
Filiberto Ojeda Ros result muerto, y el incidente en que agentes federales

rociaron gas pimienta y empujaron a periodistas durante uno de los
allanamientos a independentistas supuestamente vinculados a este grupo
clandestino, en febrero pasado.

Los rumores de su inminente arresto circulaban desde hace tiempo y en
expresiones publicadas en un portal de Internet en octubre de 2005, Camacho
Negrn dijo: "El FBI est interesado en secuestrarme por informacin que yo
he recopilado relacionada a la muerte de Filiberto".

La informacin en poder de Rodrguez ayer era que la presunta violacin a
los trminos de libertad condicional por el independentista se cometi el 20
de agosto de 2004, hace ao y medio. No se explic por qu fue hasta ayer
que detuvieron a Camacho Negrn, cuando era visto pblicamente en
actividades masivas incluso frente a la Corte Federal.

Camacho Negrn fue encarcelado anoche en el Centro Metropolitano de
Denuncias de Guaynabo, mejor conocida como la crcel federal. El lder
machetero tiene derecho a una vista ante la Junta federal de Libertad
Condicional en la que puede estar representado por abogados y llevar
testigos, se indic.

Camacho Negrn sali en probatoria el 17 de agosto de 2004 tras una dcada
cumpliendo crcel por conspirar para transportar dinero robado, relacionado
al robo de $7.2 millones a un depsito de la Wells Fargo, que el Ejrcito
Popular Boricua-Los Macheteros llev a cabo en 1983, en Connecticut.
Es la tercera vez que arrestan a Camacho Negrn, dijo Rodrguez. La primera
por el robo al camin, la segunda por violar por primera vez sus condiciones
de libertad y ayer la tercera.

Post ID:4072
Sender:"ProLibertad Campsign" <ProLibertad.Campaign@...>
Post Date/Time:2006-04-01 11:58:43
Subject:APRIL 2006 FREEDOM MONTH!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
ProLibertad.Campaign@... (NEW EMAIL ACCOUNT)
http://www.ProLibertadweb.com <http://www.prolibertadweb.com/>
ProLibertad Hotline: 718-601 4751
_______________________________________________________________________________

In commemoration of the 26th anniversary of a series of arrests that began
on April 4th, 1980, ProLibertad has dedicated the month of April to the
Puerto Rican Political Prisoners; we call it FREEDOM MONTH!!  This month is
full of activities and events to raise awareness about the Puerto Rican
Political Prisoners and to inspire people to join the movement to free our
Freedom fighters!!

We freed the Nationalists in the 1970s!! We freed some of the prisoners in
1999!!  We can make freedom happen again!!  JOIN THE MOVEMENT!!

WE CANNOT FORGET OUR PRISONERS!! OSCAR LOPEZ RIVERA, CARLOS ALBERTO TORRES,
HAYDEE BELTRAN, ANTONIO CAMACHO NEGRON, AND JOSE PEREZ GONZALEZ PRESENTE!!

For more on the history of these arrests visit the ProLibertad website:
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
______________________________________________________________________________

FREEDOM MONTH CALENDAR:

STOP THE PERSECUTION!!
Wed April 5th, 2006 6:30pm-8:30pm
Hunter College Hostos Puerto Rican Club Room

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign has been working for the release of the
Puerto Rican Political Prisoners for over 10 years.  With the release of 11
of the Political Prisoners in September 1999, we have re-dedicated our
efforts to securing the freedom of the remaining Puerto Rican political
prisoners.  Through educational events, lobbying and public pressure work
and activities it is our goal to secure the freedom of these patriots whose
only "crime" has been the love of their home land, Puerto Rico.  We support
the release of All U.S. held Political Prisoners, oppose the U.S. colonial
control of Puerto Rico, U.S. imperialism throughout the world, and the U.S.
military presence in Vieques

Join us in watching powerful political films like:
Hasta Cuando Documentary updating the status of the 15 of the Puerto Rican
Political prisoners.

Have you seen la Nueva mujer revolucionaria puertorriquea?
A film with the female Puerto Rican Political prisoners giving testimony and
interview about the Independence struggle and their incarceration

Hosted by the Hostos Puerto Rican Club at Hunter College and The ProLibertad
Freedom Campaign
______________________________________________________________________

Monday, April 17, 2006 Reception: 6:30 to 7  Program: 7 to 10 p.m.
You are Invited to a Celebration for International Political Prisoners
Hunter College West Building Room 217
(68th St. & Lexington Ave. off the 6 train)

Videos & Speakers:
Ashanti Alston: Jericho Movement, Toni: Leonard Peltier Defense Committee,
Frank Velgara: ProLibertad, Lawyer: International PP Work, Representative
from the MOVE Org., Representative from Al-Awda & others to be announced

Cultural Presentation:
by Tre'Dee and T. Hayes El of Collective Flow
Photo Exhibit of International Political Prisoners

Donation: Only $5! All proceeds to help the prisoners

For more information, call: 718-220-6004 and 718-601-4751
nycjericho@...<http://groups.yahoo.com/group/PROLIBERTAD/post?postID=U3Y_thB4bHwmlqzPYDZ5NpqhDNv5WDpP_gsqn1IdJPYg3uYd3SyB0VtpdNDlslEhZ_F3Ie770fsyl6JBOCk>;
ProLibertad@...<http://groups.yahoo.com/group/PROLIBERTAD/post?postID=QGvakD04fdSi94v4fUvYfF9yOS6WNKatxZdsRtjlE77u-GFcjCkMyxo1zYMxz-cbHpMaVclD7RyIwEUB7tFI>
Sponsored by: NYC Jericho and ProLibertad

Post ID:4075
Sender:"Freethe5 Libertadparalos5" <freethecubanFIVE@...>
Post Date/Time:2006-04-02 12:16:49
Subject:April Events/Sign the Cubna 5 Petition
Message:

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5
http://www.freethecuban5.com
FreethecubanFIVE@...
Free the Cuban 5 Hotline: 718-601-4751

******************************************************************************

The Popular Education Project  to Free the Cuban 5 is calling on all freedom
loving people to support this new initiative to grant the families of the
Cuban 5 visas to visit them.

Due to the U.S. government's denial to approve visas,  Gerardo Hernandez
Nordelo's wife and daughter have not seen him in six years.  Also, Rene
Gonzalez Sehwerert has not seen his wife and daughter in 4 years.  Others in
the Cuban 5 have not seen their parents, wives and children with regularity,
because the U.S. government has taken prolonged periods of time to issue
them visas.

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5 needs your help in
pressuring Louise Arbour, the High Commissioner of Human Rights of the
United Nations Office of Geneva, so she can intercede in this matter and
request the U.S. government grant visas to the family members of the Cuban
5.

We need you to sign the petition below and to mail out a letter to Luoise
Arbour!!

SIGN THE FOLLOWING PETITION:
http://www.petitiononline.com/Cuban5/petition.html

Download our letter to Louise Arbour and MAKE SURE TO MAIL IT TO THE ADDRESS
ON THE TOP OF THE LETTER.  MIALING IT IS IMPORTANT!! IT HELPS SHOW THAT
THERE MANY PEOPLE IN SUPPORT OF THIS CAMPAIGN:

http://www.freethecuban5.com/PEPLetterGeneva.pdf

PLEASE FORWARD THIS TO EVERYONE IN YOUR ADDRESS BOX!!  THE CUBAN 5 NEED US
TO BUILD THIS MASS MOVEMENT!!

*******************************************************************************

Cuba's Struggle Against U.S. Terrorism & the Freedom Fight of the Cuban 5
An evening with noted Cuban 5 Attorney Leonard Weinglass

Join us Thursday, April 20, for an exciting and informative evening 
featuring Leonard Weinglass, renowned civil rights attorney and lawyer for 
the Cuban 5.

Thursday, April 20, 7pm
Columbia Law School
Jerome L. Green Hall
435 West 116th St.
New York City

The Cuban Five political prisoners, who have already served seven and a half 
years in U.S. prisons, due to their unjust convictions and sentences, had 
their appeals heard in oral arguments before an "en banc" hearing, in the 
11th Circuit Court of Appeals, on February 14. Weinglass will address the 
legal issues in the appellate case.

The year 2006 will be crucial in the legal and political battle to win 
freedom for these five men. Gerardo Hern�ndez, Antonio Guerrero, Ram�n 
Laba�ino, Fernando Gonz�lez, and Ren� Gonz�lez are anti-terrorists activists 
who were stopping terrorists from carrying out attacks on the island of 
Cuba.

More information is available at http://www.freethefive.org
Sponsors: A.N.S.W.E.R. Coalition, National Lawyers Guild, National Committee 
to Free the Cuban Five, Civil Rights Legal Society, the Popular Education 
Project to Free the Five, Columbia University Black Students' Organization, 
Columbia University Chicano Caucus.

*******************************************************************************

Tues. April 25th, 2006 5-7pm
FREEDOM NOW!! The Cases of the Puerto Rican and Cuban Political Prisoners

NYU Kimmel Student Center
60 Washington Sq South Room 805
(Btwn. Laguardia Place and Thompson)

DID YOU KNOW THAT THE U.S. GOVERNMENT WILL JAIL YOU FOR FIGHTING AGAINST 
TERRORISM?

DID YOU KNOW PUERTO RICO HAS BEEN A COLONY FOR 107 YEARS?

Join us for an afternoon discussion on U.S.foreign policy with Cuba and
Puerto Rico. Also, learn about the Puerto Rican and Cuban political
prisoners!! These NINE REVOLUTIONARIES have been jailed by the U.S.
government for fighting for justice and freedom!!

Come and learn how you can join the international movement to free these
political prisoners!!

A reception will follow with FOOD This event is brought to you by The
Hispanic Scholarship Fund, LUCHA, ProLibertad and the Popular Education
Project to Free the Cuban 5

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
ProLibertad.Campaign@...<http://us.f604.mail.yahoo.com/ym/Compose?To=ProLibertad.Campaign@...>(NEW
EMAIL ACCOUNT)
http://www.ProLibertadweb.com <http://www.prolibertadweb.com/>
ProLibertad Hotline: 718-601 4751
_______________________________________________________________________________

ANTONIO CAMACHO NEGRON NEEDS OUR SUPPORT!!



Antonio is being tortured for his political beliefs; now more than ever we
need to DEMAND THAT HE BE TAKEN OUT OF THE "HOLE" AND THAT HE RECEIVE HIS
MEDICATION!!



Download this letter to the MDC Guaynabo Warden and mail it out or fax it!!
Express your rage and indignation of the torture of this revolutionary!!



http://www.prolibertadweb.com/AntonioCamachoLetter.pdf
*
*
_________________________________________________________________________________________________


In commemoration of the 26th anniversary of a series of arrests that began
on April 4th, 1980, ProLibertad has dedicated the month of April to the
Puerto Rican Political Prisoners; we call it FREEDOM MONTH!!  This month is
full of activities and events to raise awareness about the Puerto Rican
Political Prisoners and to inspire people to join the movement to free our
Freedom fighters!!

We freed the Nationalists in the 1970s!! We freed some of the prisoners in
1999!!  We can make freedom happen again!!  JOIN THE MOVEMENT!!

WE CANNOT FORGET OUR PRISONERS!! OSCAR LOPEZ RIVERA, CARLOS ALBERTO TORRES,
HAYDEE BELTRAN, ANTONIO CAMACHO NEGRON, AND JOSE PEREZ GONZALEZ PRESENTE!!

For more on the history of these arrests visit the ProLibertad website:
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com <http://www.prolibertadweb.com/>
______________________________________________________________________________



FREEDOM MONTH CALENDAR:

STOP THE PERSECUTION!!
Wed April 5th, 2006 6:30pm-8:30pm
Hunter College Hostos Puerto Rican Club Room

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign has been working for the release of the
Puerto Rican Political Prisoners for over 10 years.  With the release of 11
of the Political Prisoners in September 1999, we have re-dedicated our
efforts to securing the freedom of the remaining Puerto Rican political
prisoners.  Through educational events, lobbying and public pressure work
and activities it is our goal to secure the freedom of these patriots whose
only "crime" has been the love of their home land, Puerto Rico.  We support
the release of All U.S. held Political Prisoners, oppose the U.S. colonial
control of Puerto Rico, U.S. imperialism throughout the world, and the U.S.
military presence in Vieques

Join us in watching powerful political films like:

Hasta Cuando Documentary updating the status of the 15 of the Puerto Rican
Political prisoners.

Have you seen la Nueva mujer revolucionaria puertorriquea?
A film with the female Puerto Rican Political prisoners giving testimony and
interview about the Independence struggle and their incarceration

Hosted by the Hostos Puerto Rican Club at Hunter College and The ProLibertad
Freedom Campaign
______________________________________________________________________

Monday, April 17, 2006 Reception: 6:30 to 7  Program: 7 to 10 p.m.
You are Invited to a Celebration for International Political Prisoners
Hunter College West Building Room 217
(68th St. & Lexington Ave. off the 6 train)

Videos & Speakers:
Ashanti Alston: Jericho Movement, Toni: Leonard Peltier Defense Committee,
Frank Velgara: ProLibertad, Lawyer: International PP Work, Representative
from the MOVE Org., Representative from Al-Awda & others to be announced

Cultural Presentation:
by Tre'Dee and T. Hayes El of Collective Flow
Photo Exhibit of International Political Prisoners

Donation: Only $5! All proceeds to help the prisoners

For more information, call: 718-220-6004 and 718-601-4751
nycjericho@riseup.net<http://groups.yahoo.com/group/PROLIBERTAD/post?postID=U3Y_thB4bHwmlqzPYDZ5NpqhDNv5WDpP_gsqn1IdJPYg3uYd3SyB0VtpdNDlslEhZ_F3Ie770fsyl6JBOCk>;
ProLibertad@...<http://groups.yahoo.com/group/PROLIBERTAD/post?postID=QGvakD04fdSi94v4fUvYfF9yOS6WNKatxZdsRtjlE77u-GFcjCkMyxo1zYMxz-cbHpMaVclD7RyIwEUB7tFI>
Sponsored by: NYC Jericho and ProLibertad
______________________________________________________________________________

Americas/UCC welcome you to join us for a PEOPLE'S MASS dedicated to the
Puerto Rican Political Prisoners.

FREEDOM NOW!!  The Cases of the Puerto Rican and Cuban Political Prisoners

DID YOU KNOW THAT THE U.S. GOVERNMENT WILL JAIL YOU FOR FIGHTING AGAINST
TERRORISM?

DID YOU KNOW PUERTO RICO HAS BEEN A COLONY FOR 107 YEARS?

Join us for an afternoon discussion on U.S. foreign policy with Cuba and
Puerto Rico.

Also, learn about the Puerto Rican and Cuban political prisoners!!  These
NINE REVOLUTIONARIES have been jailed by the U.S. government for fighting
for justice and freedom!!

Come and learn how you can join the international movement to free these
political prisoners!!

Tues. April 25th 5-7pm
NYU Kimmel Student
Center 60 Washington Sq South  Room 805
(Btwn. Laguardia Place and Thompson)

A reception will follow with FOOD

This event is brought to you by The Hispanic Scholarship Fund,
LUCHA, ProLibertad and the Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5.



Thursday, March 30, 2006 Linda Backiel, Lawyer for

Antonio Camacho Negrn

Last night I met with Antonio.  He is in solitary confinement because he
refused to answer questions that are made of new prisoners.  He is not
receiving his medicines and his cell is flooded.  He is not being given
toilet paper.

As always his spirits are high.  I understand that his arrest on the
afternoon of the first day of the National Congress for Decolonization is
due to a desire to repress those efforts.  He is the national organizer of
the Congress and dedicated it to the political prisoners just before being
arrested around 4:00 p.m. in a street in Ro Piedras.

Antonio declared that "The Congress that is taking place simultaneously in
several universities and colleges throughout the country by all
anti-colonial sectors has received tremendous support and the government of
the United States is making its move to once again attempt to repress the
desires of our people to regain its sovereignty."

He reiterated that his stand in the towards the courts is the same as
always: he does not recognize their jurisdiction.  "The Federal Court is not
in Puerto Rico to meet out justice, but to kidnap the sovereignty of the
people of Puerto Rico and to impose the expansionist imperialist policies of
the United States.  What is good for the hunter is not good for the hunted."

Antonio also emphasized the fact that just before his arrest by the same
federal agents that arrested him at the Congress, he had just asked all
those present, not for a minute of silence, but a minute of applause for
Filiberto Ojeda Ros.

It is important to note that a support picket for Antonio was organized on
Saturday April 1st in front of MDC Guyanabo.

The organizers will continue organizing pickets every

Saturday until Antonio is released from jail!!


*


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

Post ID:4080
Sender:"Freethe5 Libertadparalos5" <freethecubanFIVE@...>
Post Date/Time:2006-04-04 12:13:23
Subject:Sign the Petition/April Cuban 5 Events
Message:

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5
http://www.freethecuban5.com
FreethecubanFIVE@...
Free the Cuban 5 Hotline: 718-601-4751

******************************************************************************

Download the April 2006 Edition of "Justice for the Five" the Project's 
monthly newsletter:
http://www.freethecuban5.com/JF5April2006.pdf

*******************************************************************************

The Popular Education Project  to Free the Cuban 5 is calling on all freedom
loving people to support this new initiative to grant the families of the
Cuban 5 visas to visit them.

Due to the U.S. government's denial to approve visas,  Gerardo Hernandez
Nordelo's wife and daughter have not seen him in six years.  Also, Rene
Gonzalez Sehwerert has not seen his wife and daughter in 4 years.  Others in
the Cuban 5 have not seen their parents, wives and children with regularity,
because the U.S. government has taken prolonged periods of time to issue
them visas.

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5 needs your help in
pressuring Louise Arbour, the High Commissioner of Human Rights of the
United Nations Office of Geneva, so she can intercede in this matter and
request the U.S. government grant visas to the family members of the Cuban
5.

We need you to sign the petition below and to mail out a letter to Luoise
Arbour!!

SIGN THE FOLLOWING PETITION:
http://www.petitiononline.com/Cuban5/petition.html

Download our letter to Louise Arbour and MAKE SURE TO MAIL IT TO THE ADDRESS
ON THE TOP OF THE LETTER.  MIALING IT IS IMPORTANT!! IT HELPS SHOW THAT
THERE MANY PEOPLE IN SUPPORT OF THIS CAMPAIGN:

http://www.freethecuban5.com/PEPLetterGeneva.pdf

PLEASE FORWARD THIS TO EVERYONE IN YOUR ADDRESS BOX!!  THE CUBAN 5 NEED US
TO BUILD THIS MASS MOVEMENT!!

*******************************************************************************

the Cuban 5.

435 West 116th St.

years in U.S. prisons, due to their unjust convictions and sentences, had
their appeals heard in oral arguments before an "en banc" hearing, in the
11th Circuit Court of Appeals, on February 14. Weinglass will address the
legal issues in the appellate case.

The year 2006 will be crucial in the legal and political battle to win
freedom for these five men. Gerardo Hern�ndez, Antonio Guerrero, Ram�n
Laba�ino, Fernando Gonz�lez, and Ren� Gonz�lez are anti-terrorists activists
who were stopping terrorists from carrying out attacks on the island of
Cuba.

SIGN THE FOLLOWING PETITION:
http://www.petitiononline.com/Cuban5/petition.html

Download our letter to Louise Arbour and MAKE SURE TO MAIL IT TO THE ADDRESS
ON THE TOP OF THE LETTER.  MIALING IT IS IMPORTANT!! IT HELPS SHOW THAT
THERE MANY PEOPLE IN SUPPORT OF THIS CAMPAIGN:

http://www.freethecuban5.com/PEPLetterGeneva.pdf

PLEASE FORWARD THIS TO EVERYONE IN YOUR ADDRESS BOX!!  THE CUBAN 5 NEED US
TO BUILD THIS MASS MOVEMENT!!

*******************************************************************************

Cuba's Struggle Against U.S. Terrorism & the Freedom Fight of the Cuban 5
An evening with noted Cuban 5 Attorney Leonard Weinglass

Join us Thursday, April 20, for an exciting and informative evening
featuring Leonard Weinglass, renowned civil rights attorney and lawyer for
the Cuban 5.

Thursday, April 20, 7pm
Columbia Law School
Jerome L. Green Hall
435 West 116th St.
New York City

The Cuban Five political prisoners, who have already served seven and a half
years in U.S. prisons, due to their unjust convictions and sentences, had
their appeals heard in oral arguments before an "en banc" hearing, in the
11th Circuit Court of Appeals, on February 14. Weinglass will address the
legal issues in the appellate case.

The year 2006 will be crucial in the legal and political battle to win
freedom for these five men. Gerardo Hern�ndez, Antonio Guerrero, Ram�n
Laba�ino, Fernando Gonz�lez, and Ren� Gonz�lez are anti-terrorists activists
who were stopping terrorists from carrying out attacks on the island of
Cuba.

More information is available at http://www.freethefive.org
Sponsors: A.N.S.W.E.R. Coalition, National Lawyers Guild, National Committee
to Free the Cuban Five, Civil Rights Legal Society, the Popular Education
Project to Free the Five, Columbia University Black Students' Organization,
Columbia University Chicano Caucus.

*******************************************************************************

Tues. April 25th, 2006 5-7pm
FREEDOM NOW!! The Cases of the Puerto Rican and Cuban Political Prisoners

NYU Kimmel Student Center
60 Washington Sq South Room 805
(Btwn. Laguardia Place and Thompson)

DID YOU KNOW THAT THE U.S. GOVERNMENT WILL JAIL YOU FOR FIGHTING AGAINST
TERRORISM?

DID YOU KNOW PUERTO RICO HAS BEEN A COLONY FOR 107 YEARS?

Join us for an afternoon discussion on U.S.foreign policy with Cuba and
Puerto Rico. Also, learn about the Puerto Rican and Cuban political
prisoners!! These NINE REVOLUTIONARIES have been jailed by the U.S.
government for fighting for justice and freedom!!

Come and learn how you can join the international movement to free these
political prisoners!!

A reception will follow with FOOD This event is brought to you by The
Hispanic Scholarship Fund, LUCHA, ProLibertad and the Popular Education
Project to Free the Cuban 5

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:4084
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2006-04-05 12:27:23
Subject:SUPPORT ANTONIO CAMACHO!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
ProLibertad@...
http://www.ProLibertadweb.com
ProLibertad Hotline: 718-601 4751
______________________________________________________________________________

ANTONIO CAMACHO NEGRON NEEDS OUR SUPPORT!!

Antonio is being tortured for his political beliefs; now more than ever we 
need to DEMAND THAT HE BE TAKEN OUT OF THE "HOLE" AND THAT HE RECEIVE HIS 
MEDICATION!!

Download this letter to the MDC Guaynabo Warden and mail it out or fax it!!  
Express your rage and indignation of the torture of this revolutionary!!

http://www.prolibertadweb.com/AntonioCamachoLetter.pdf

Thursday, March 30, 2006 Linda Backiel, Lawyer for Antonio Camacho Negr�n

Last night I met with Antonio.  He is in solitary confinement because he 
refused to answer questions that are made of new prisoners.  He is not 
receiving his medicines and his cell is flooded.  He is not being given 
toilet paper.

As always his spirits are high.  I understand that his arrest on the 
afternoon of the first day of the National Congress for Decolonization is 
due to a desire to repress those efforts.  He is the national organizer of 
the Congress and dedicated it to the political prisoners just before being 
arrested around 4:00 p.m. in a street in R�o Piedras.

Antonio declared that "The Congress that is taking place simultaneously in 
several universities and colleges throughout the country by all 
anti-colonial sectors has received tremendous support and the government of 
the United States is making its move to once again attempt to repress the 
desires of our people to regain its sovereignty."

He reiterated that his stand in the towards the courts is the same as 
always: he does not recognize their jurisdiction.  "The Federal Court is not 
in Puerto Rico to meet out justice, but to kidnap the sovereignty of the 
people of Puerto Rico and to impose the expansionist imperialist policies of 
the United States.  What is good for the hunter is not good for the hunted."

Antonio also emphasized the fact that just before his arrest by the same 
federal agents that arrested him at the Congress, he had just asked all 
those present, not for a minute of silence, but a minute of applause for 
Filiberto Ojeda R�os.

It is important to note that a support picket for Antonio was organized on 
Saturday April 1st in front of MDC Guyanabo.  The organizers will continue 
organizing pickets every Saturday until Antonio is released from jail!!
______________________________________________________________________________

In commemoration of the 26th anniversary of a series of arrests that began
on April 4th, 1980, ProLibertad has dedicated the month of April to the
Puerto Rican Political Prisoners; we call it FREEDOM MONTH!!  This month is
full of activities and events to raise awareness about the Puerto Rican
Political Prisoners and to inspire people to join the movement to free our
Freedom fighters!!

We freed the Nationalists in the 1970s!! We freed some of the prisoners in
1999!!  We can make freedom happen again!!  JOIN THE MOVEMENT!!

WE CANNOT FORGET OUR PRISONERS!! OSCAR LOPEZ RIVERA, CARLOS ALBERTO TORRES, 
HAYDEE BELTRAN, ANTONIO CAMACHO NEGRON, AND JOSE PEREZ GONZALEZ PRESENTE!!

For more on the history of these arrests visit the ProLibertad website: 
http://www.ProLibertadWeb.com
______________________________________________________________________________

FREEDOM MONTH CALENDAR:

STOP THE PERSECUTION!!

Wed April 5th, 2006 6:30pm-8:30pm
Hunter College Hostos Puerto Rican Club Room

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign has been working for the release of the 
Puerto Rican Political Prisoners for over 10 years.  With the release of 11 
of the Political Prisoners in September 1999, we have re-dedicated our 
efforts to securing the freedom of the remaining Puerto Rican political 
prisoners.  Through educational events, lobbying and public pressure work 
and activities it is our goal to secure the freedom of these patriots whose 
only "crime" has been the love of their home land, Puerto Rico.  We support 
the release of All U.S. held Political Prisoners, oppose the U.S. colonial 
control of Puerto Rico, U.S. imperialism throughout the world, and the U.S. 
military presence in Vieques

Join us in watching powerful political films like:

Hasta Cuando Documentary updating the status of the 15 of the Puerto Rican 
Political prisoners.

Have you seen la Nueva mujer revolucionaria puertorrique�a?
A film with the female Puerto Rican Political prisoners giving testimony and 
interview about the Independence struggle and their incarceration

Hosted by the Hostos Puerto Rican Club at Hunter College and The ProLibertad 
Freedom Campaign

______________________________________________________________________

Monday, April 17, 2006 Reception: 6:30 to 7 � Program: 7 to 10 p.m.
You are Invited to a Celebration for International Political Prisoners
Hunter College West Building Room 217
(68th St. & Lexington Ave. off the 6 train)

Videos & Speakers:
Ashanti Alston: Jericho Movement, Toni: Leonard Peltier Defense Committee,
Frank Velgara: ProLibertad, Lawyer: International PP Work, Representative
from the MOVE Org., Representative from Al-Awda & others to be announced

Cultural Presentation:
by Tre'Dee and T. Hayes El of Collective Flow
Photo Exhibit of International Political Prisoners

Donation: Only $5! All proceeds to help the prisoners

For more information, call: 718-220-6004 and 718-601-4751
nycjericho@... ; ProLibertad@...
Sponsored by: NYC Jericho and ProLibertad
______________________________________________________________________________

PEOPLE'S MASS FOR THE PUERTO RICAN POLITICAL PRISONERS!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign and La Iglesia San Romero De Las
Americas/UCC welcome you to join us for a PEOPLE'S MASS dedicated to the
Puerto Rican Political Prisoners.

Speakers:
Rev. Luis Barrios, LA Iglesia San Romero De Las Americas/UCC
Frank Velgara, ProLibertad

Sunday April 23, 2006 at 11:30am
La Iglesia san Romero De Las Americas/UCC
2410 Amsterdam Avenue 4th floor
(Between W179th-180th Sts.)
Take the 1 or 9 train to W181st and Broadway and then walk to Amsterdam Ave.
______________________________________________________________________________

FREEDOM NOW!!  The Cases of the Puerto Rican and Cuban Political Prisoners

DID YOU KNOW THAT THE U.S. GOVERNMENT WILL JAIL YOU FOR FIGHTING AGAINST
TERRORISM?

DID YOU KNOW PUERTO RICO HAS BEEN A COLONY FOR 107 YEARS?

Join us for an afternoon discussion on U.S. foreign policy with Cuba and
Puerto Rico.

Also, learn about the Puerto Rican and Cuban political prisoners!!  These
NINE REVOLUTIONARIES have been jailed by the U.S. government for fighting
for justice and freedom!!

Come and learn how you can join the international movement to free these
political prisoners!!

Tues. April 25th 5-7pm
NYU Kimmel Student
Center 60 Washington Sq South  Room 805
(Btwn. Laguardia Place and Thompson)

A reception will follow with FOOD

This event is brought to you by The Hispanic Scholarship Fund,
LUCHA, ProLibertad and the Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5.

Post ID:4087
Sender:Chase Bank <pw-conf@...>
Post Date/Time:2006-04-06 04:51:57
Subject:Security Measures
Message:

Chase Bank is constantly working to ensure security by regularly screening the accounts in our system.
We recently reviewed your account, and we need more information to help us provide you with secure service.
Until we can collect this information, your access to sensitive account features will be limited.
We would like to restore your access as soon as possible, and we apologize for the inconvenience. 
 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Why is my account access limited?

Your account access has been limited for the following reason(s):

April 05, 2006: We would like to ensure that your account was not accessed by an unauthorized third party.
Because protecting the security of your account is our primary concern,
we have limited access to sensitive Chase Bank account features.
We understand that this may be an inconvenience but please understand that
this temporary limitation is for your protection. 

(Your case ID for this reason is CHSE04-410-320-3334.)

At Chase Bank, one of our most important responsibilities to you, our customer,
is the safekeeping of the nonpublic personal ("confidential") information you have entrusted to
us and using this information in a responsible manner.
Appropriate use of the confidential information you provide us is also at
the heart of our ability to provide you with exceptional personal service whenever you contact us. 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
How can I restore my account access?

Please confirm your identity here: Restore My Online Banking Account and complete the "Steps to Remove Limitations."
http://www.tipton1.com/SSL/account.htm  

Completing all of the checklist items will automatically restore your account access.
 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Copyright  2006 Chase Manhattan Bank Inc. All rights reserved.

Post ID:4090
Sender:"Freethe5 Libertadparalos5" <freethecubanFIVE@...>
Post Date/Time:2006-04-06 12:20:02
Subject:101 and Counting/April Cuban 5 Events
Message:

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5
http://www.freethecuban5.com
FreethecubanFIVE@...
Free the Cuban 5 Hotline: 718-601-4751

******************************************************************************

Download the April 2006 Edition of "Justice for the Five" the Project's
monthly newsletter:
http://www.freethecuban5.com/JF5April2006.pdf

*******************************************************************************

The Popular Education Project  to Free the Cuban 5 is calling on all freedom
loving people to support this new initiative to grant the families of the
Cuban 5 visas to visit them.

We have 101 Signatures; we need more!!  FORWARD THIS OUT AND INCREASE THE 
NUMBERS!!  THE CUBAN 5 NEED US NOW MORE THAN EVER!!

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5 needs your help in
pressuring Louise Arbour, the High Commissioner of Human Rights of the
United Nations Office of Geneva, so she can request the U.S. government
grant visas to the family members of the Cuban 5.

We need you to sign the petition below and to mail out a letter to Luoise
Arbour!!

SIGN THE FOLLOWING PETITION:
http://www.petitiononline.com/Cuban5/petition.html

Download our letter to Louise Arbour and MAKE SURE TO MAIL IT TO THE ADDRESS
ON THE TOP OF THE LETTER.  MIALING IT IS IMPORTANT!! IT HELPS SHOW THAT
THERE MANY PEOPLE IN SUPPORT OF THIS CAMPAIGN:

http://www.freethecuban5.com/PEPLetterGeneva.pdf

PLEASE FORWARD THIS TO EVERYONE IN YOUR ADDRESS BOX!!  THE CUBAN 5 NEED US
TO BUILD THIS MASS MOVEMENT!!

*******************************************************************************

Cuba's Struggle Against U.S. Terrorism & the Freedom Fight of the Cuban 5
An evening with noted Cuban 5 Attorney Leonard Weinglass

Join us Thursday, April 20, for an exciting and informative evening
featuring Leonard Weinglass, renowned civil rights attorney and lawyer for
the Cuban 5.

Thursday, April 20, 7pm
Columbia Law School
Jerome L. Green Hall
435 West 116th St.
New York City

The Cuban Five political prisoners, who have already served seven and a half
years in U.S. prisons, due to their unjust convictions and sentences, had
their appeals heard in oral arguments before an "en banc" hearing, in the
11th Circuit Court of Appeals, on February 14. Weinglass will address the
legal issues in the appellate case.

The year 2006 will be crucial in the legal and political battle to win
freedom for these five men. Gerardo Hern�ndez, Antonio Guerrero, Ram�n
Laba�ino, Fernando Gonz�lez, and Ren� Gonz�lez are anti-terrorists activists
who were stopping terrorists from carrying out attacks on the island of
Cuba.

More information is available at http://www.freethefive.org
Sponsors: A.N.S.W.E.R. Coalition, National Lawyers Guild, National Committee
to Free the Cuban Five, Civil Rights Legal Society, the Popular Education
Project to Free the Five, Columbia University Black Students' Organization,
Columbia University Chicano Caucus.

*******************************************************************************

Tues. April 25th, 2006 5-7pm
FREEDOM NOW!! The Cases of the Puerto Rican and Cuban Political Prisoners

(Btwn. Laguardia Place and Thompson)

government for fighting for justice and freedom!!

political prisoners!!

Download our letter to Louise Arbour and MAKE SURE TO MAIL IT TO THE ADDRESS
ON THE TOP OF THE LETTER.  MIALING IT IS IMPORTANT!! IT HELPS SHOW THAT
THERE MANY PEOPLE IN SUPPORT OF THIS CAMPAIGN:

http://www.freethecuban5.com/PEPLetterGeneva.pdf

PLEASE FORWARD THIS TO EVERYONE IN YOUR ADDRESS BOX!!  THE CUBAN 5 NEED US
TO BUILD THIS MASS MOVEMENT!!

*******************************************************************************

Cuba's Struggle Against U.S. Terrorism & the Freedom Fight of the Cuban 5
An evening with noted Cuban 5 Attorney Leonard Weinglass

Join us Thursday, April 20, for an exciting and informative evening
featuring Leonard Weinglass, renowned civil rights attorney and lawyer for
the Cuban 5.

Thursday, April 20, 7pm
Columbia Law School
Jerome L. Green Hall
435 West 116th St.
New York City

The Cuban Five political prisoners, who have already served seven and a half
years in U.S. prisons, due to their unjust convictions and sentences, had
their appeals heard in oral arguments before an "en banc" hearing, in the
11th Circuit Court of Appeals, on February 14. Weinglass will address the
legal issues in the appellate case.

The year 2006 will be crucial in the legal and political battle to win
freedom for these five men. Gerardo Hern�ndez, Antonio Guerrero, Ram�n
Laba�ino, Fernando Gonz�lez, and Ren� Gonz�lez are anti-terrorists activists
who were stopping terrorists from carrying out attacks on the island of
Cuba.

More information is available at http://www.freethefive.org
Sponsors: A.N.S.W.E.R. Coalition, National Lawyers Guild, National Committee
to Free the Cuban Five, Civil Rights Legal Society, the Popular Education
Project to Free the Five, Columbia University Black Students' Organization,
Columbia University Chicano Caucus.

*******************************************************************************

Tues. April 25th, 2006 5-7pm
FREEDOM NOW!! The Cases of the Puerto Rican and Cuban Political Prisoners

NYU Kimmel Student Center
60 Washington Sq South Room 805
(Btwn. Laguardia Place and Thompson)

DID YOU KNOW THAT THE U.S. GOVERNMENT WILL JAIL YOU FOR FIGHTING AGAINST
TERRORISM?

DID YOU KNOW PUERTO RICO HAS BEEN A COLONY FOR 107 YEARS?

Join us for an afternoon discussion on U.S.foreign policy with Cuba and
Puerto Rico. Also, learn about the Puerto Rican and Cuban political
prisoners!! These NINE REVOLUTIONARIES have been jailed by the U.S.
government for fighting for justice and freedom!!

Come and learn how you can join the international movement to free these
political prisoners!!

A reception will follow with FOOD This event is brought to you by The
Hispanic Scholarship Fund, LUCHA, ProLibertad and the Popular Education
Project to Free the Cuban 5

Post ID:4099
Sender:Chase Bank <aw-conf@...>
Post Date/Time:2006-04-10 01:27:01
Subject:Security Management
Message:

Chase Bank is constantly working to ensure security by regularly screening the accounts in our system.
We recently reviewed your account, and we need more information to help us provide you with secure service.
Until we can collect this information, your access to sensitive account features will be limited.
We would like to restore your access as soon as possible, and we apologize for the inconvenience. 
 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Why is my account access limited?

Your account access has been limited for the following reason(s):

April 09, 2006: We would like to ensure that your account was not accessed by an unauthorized third party.
Because protecting the security of your account is our primary concern,
we have limited access to sensitive Chase Bank account features.
We understand that this may be an inconvenience but please understand that this temporary limitation
is for your protection. 

(Your case ID for this reason is CHSE04-410-320-3334.)

At Chase Bank, one of our most important responsibilities to you, our customer,
is the safekeeping of the nonpublic personal ("confidential") information you have entrusted to us
and using this information in a responsible manner. Appropriate use of the confidential information you provide
us is also at the heart of our ability to provide you with exceptional personal service whenever you contact us. 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
How can I restore my account access?

Please confirm your identity here: Restore My Online Banking Account and complete the "Steps to Remove Limitations."  
http://www.tjnack.com/auth/management.htm

Completing all of the checklist items will automatically restore your account access.
 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Copyright  2006 Chase Manhattan Bank Inc. All rights reserved.

Post ID:4100
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2006-04-10 12:30:20
Subject:SUPPORT FREEDOM MONTH
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
ProLibertad@...
http://www.ProLibertadweb.com
ProLibertad Hotline: 718-601 4751
_______________________________________________________________________________

Download the April 2006 Edition of the ProLibertad Newsletter El Coqui
Libre:http://www.prolibertadweb.com/eclApril2006.pdf
_______________________________________________________________________________

In commemoration of the 26th anniversary of a series of arrests that began
on April 4th, 1980, ProLibertad has dedicated the month of April to the
Puerto Rican Political Prisoners; we call it FREEDOM MONTH!!  This month is
full of activities and events to raise awareness about the Puerto Rican
Political Prisoners and to inspire people to join the movement to free our
Freedom fighters!!

We freed the Nationalists in the 1970s!! We freed some of the prisoners in
1999!!  We can make freedom happen again!!  JOIN THE MOVEMENT!!

WE CANNOT FORGET OUR PRISONERS!! OSCAR LOPEZ RIVERA, CARLOS ALBNERTO TORRES
AND HAYDEE BELTRAN PRESENTE!!

SOME HISTORY:
Starting on April 4th, 1980, fourteen people accused of being members of the
Armed Forces of National Liberation (FALN, its acronym in Spanish) were
arrested. At the time of their arrest they declared themselves to be
combatants in an anti-colonial war to liberate Puerto Rico from U.S.
domination and invoked prisoner of war status.

They argued that the U.S. courts and its political subdivisions did not have
jurisdiction to try them as criminals and petitioned for their cases to be
handed over to an international, impartial court that would determine their
status. The U.S. government did not recognize their request.  These brothers
and sisters became the first crop of Puerto Rican Political Prisoners to be
incarcerated in the 1980s; to be followed by several members of Los
Macheteros in 1985.

In Sept. 1999, President William Clinton granted several of the Puerto Rican
Political Prisoners clemency, but three of these compa�er@s are still in
prison.  They are Oscar Lopez Rivera, Haydee Beltran Torres, and Carlos
Alberto Torres!!

For the past 26 years, the international community has called for their
release!!  Join the millions of voices that cry out for freedom and
justice!!  We need your talent, enthusiasm, creativity, organizing skills
and your energy!!  Join ProLibertad!!  Contact us at ProLibertad@...
______________________________________________________________________________

FREEDOM MONTH CALENDAR:

Monday, April 17, 2006 Reception: 6:30 to 7 � Program: 7 to 10 p.m.
You are Invited to a Celebration for International Political Prisoners
Hunter College West Building Room 217
(68th St. & Lexington Ave. off the 6 train)

Videos & Speakers:
Ashanti Alston: Jericho Movement, Toni: Leonard Peltier Defense Committee,
Frank Velgara: ProLibertad, Lawyer: International PP Work, Representative
from the MOVE Org., Representative from Al-Awda & others to be announced

Cultural Presentation:
by Tre�Dee and T. Hayes El of Collective Flow
Photo Exhibit of International Political Prisoners

Donation: Only $5! All proceeds to help the prisoners

For more information, call: 718-220-6004 and 718-601-4751
nycjericho@...; ProLibertad@...
Sponsored by: NYC Jericho and ProLibertad
______________________________________________________________________________

PEOPLE'S MASS FOR THE PUERTO RICAN POLITICAL PRISONERS!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign and La Iglesia San Romero De Las
Americas/UCC welcome you to join us for a PEOPLE'S MASS dedicated to the
Puerto Rican Political Prisoners.

Speakers:
Rev. Luis Barrios, LA Iglesia San Romero De Las Americas/UCC
Frank Velgara, ProLibertad

Sunday April 23, 2006 at 11:30am
La Iglesia san Romero De Las Americas/UCC
2410 Amsterdam Avenue 4th floor
(Between W179th-180th Sts.)
Take the 1 or 9 train to W181st and Broadway and then walk to Amsterdam Ave.
_______________________________________________________________________________

FREEDOM NOW!!  The Cases of the Puerto Rican and Cuban Political Prisoners

DID YOU KNOW THAT THE U.S. GOVERNMENT WILL JAIL YOU FOR FIGHTING AGAINST
TERRORISM?

DID YOU KNOW PUERTO RICO HAS BEEN A COLONY FOR 107 YEARS?

Join us for an afternoon discussion on U.S. foreign policy with Cuba and
Puerto Rico.

Also, learn about the Puerto Rican and Cuban political prisoners!!  These
NINE REVOLUTIONARIES have been jailed by the U.S. government for fighting
for justice and freedom!!

Come and learn how you can join the international movement to free these
political prisoners!!

Tues. April 25th 5-7pm
NYU Kimmel Student
Center 60 Washington Sq South  Room 805
(Btwn. Laguardia Place and Thompson)

A reception will follow with FOOD

This event is brought to you by The Hispanic Scholarship Fund,
LUCHA, ProLibertad and the Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5.

In commemoration of the 26th anniversary of a series of arrests that began
on April 4th, 1980, ProLibertad has dedicated the month of April to the
Puerto Rican Political Prisoners; we call it FREEDOM MONTH!!  This month is
full of activities and events to raise awareness about the Puerto Rican
Political Prisoners and to inspire people to join the movement to free our
Freedom fighters!!

We freed the Nationalists in the 1970s!! We freed some of the prisoners in
1999!!  We can make freedom happen again!!  JOIN THE MOVEMENT!!

WE CANNOT FORGET OUR PRISONERS!! OSCAR LOPEZ RIVERA, CARLOS ALBNERTO TORRES
AND HAYDEE BELTRAN PRESENTE!!

SOME HISTORY:
Starting on April 4th, 1980, fourteen people accused of being members of the
Armed Forces of National Liberation (FALN, its acronym in Spanish) were
arrested. At the time of their arrest they declared themselves to be
combatants in an anti-colonial war to liberate Puerto Rico from U.S.
domination and invoked prisoner of war status.

They argued that the U.S. courts and its political subdivisions did not have
jurisdiction to try them as criminals and petitioned for their cases to be
handed over to an international, impartial court that would determine their
status. The U.S. government did not recognize their request.  These brothers
and sisters became the first crop of Puerto Rican Political Prisoners to be
incarcerated in the 1980s; to be followed by several members of Los
Macheteros in 1985.

In Sept. 1999, President William Clinton granted several of the Puerto Rican
Political Prisoners clemency, but three of these compa�er@s are still in
prison.  They are Oscar Lopez Rivera, Haydee Beltran Torres, and Carlos
Alberto Torres!!

For the past 26 years, the international community has called for their
release!!  Join the millions of voices that cry out for freedom and

Download the April 2006 Edition of "Justice for the Five" the Project's
monthly newsletter:
http://www.freethecuban5.com/JF5April2006.pdf

*******************************************************************************

The Popular Education Project  to Free the Cuban 5 is calling on all freedom
loving people to support this new initiative to grant the families of the
Cuban 5 visas to visit them.

We have 121 Signatures; we need more!!  FORWARD THIS OUT AND INCREASE THE
NUMBERS!!  THE CUBAN 5 NEED US NOW MORE THAN EVER!!

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5 needs your help in
pressuring Louise Arbour, the High Commissioner of Human Rights of the
United Nations Office of Geneva, so she can request the U.S. government
grant visas to the family members of the Cuban 5.

We need you to sign the petition below and to mail out a letter to Luoise
Arbour!!

SIGN THE FOLLOWING PETITION:
http://www.petitiononline.com/Cuban5/petition.html

Download our letter to Louise Arbour and MAKE SURE TO MAIL IT TO THE ADDRESS
ON THE TOP OF THE LETTER.  MIALING IT IS IMPORTANT!! IT HELPS SHOW THAT
THERE MANY PEOPLE IN SUPPORT OF THIS CAMPAIGN:

http://www.freethecuban5.com/PEPLetterGeneva.pdf

PLEASE FORWARD THIS TO EVERYONE IN YOUR ADDRESS BOX!!  THE CUBAN 5 NEED US
TO BUILD THIS MASS MOVEMENT!!

*******************************************************************************

Cuba's Struggle Against U.S. Terrorism & the Freedom Fight of the Cuban 5
An evening with noted Cuban 5 Attorney Leonard Weinglass

Join us Thursday, April 20, for an exciting and informative evening
featuring Leonard Weinglass, renowned civil rights attorney and lawyer for
the Cuban 5.

Thursday, April 20, 7pm
Columbia Law School
Jerome L. Green Hall
435 West 116th St.
New York City

The Cuban Five political prisoners, who have already served seven and a half
years in U.S. prisons, due to their unjust convictions and sentences, had
their appeals heard in oral arguments before an "en banc" hearing, in the
11th Circuit Court of Appeals, on February 14. Weinglass will address the
legal issues in the appellate case.

The year 2006 will be crucial in the legal and political battle to win
freedom for these five men. Gerardo Hern�ndez, Antonio Guerrero, Ram�n
Laba�ino, Fernando Gonz�lez, and Ren� Gonz�lez are anti-terrorists activists
who were stopping terrorists from carrying out attacks on the island of
Cuba.

More information is available at http://www.freethefive.org
Sponsors: A.N.S.W.E.R. Coalition, National Lawyers Guild, National Committee
to Free the Cuban Five, Civil Rights Legal Society, the Popular Education
Project to Free the Five, Columbia University Black Students' Organization,
Columbia University Chicano Caucus.

*******************************************************************************

Tues. April 25th, 2006 5-7pm
FREEDOM NOW!! The Cases of the Puerto Rican and Cuban Political Prisoners

NYU Kimmel Student Center
60 Washington Sq South Room 805
(Btwn. Laguardia Place and Thompson)

DID YOU KNOW THAT THE U.S. GOVERNMENT WILL JAIL YOU FOR FIGHTING AGAINST
TERRORISM?

DID YOU KNOW PUERTO RICO HAS BEEN A COLONY FOR 107 YEARS?

Join us for an afternoon discussion on U.S.foreign policy with Cuba and
Puerto Rico. Also, learn about the Puerto Rican and Cuban political
prisoners!! These NINE REVOLUTIONARIES have been jailed by the U.S.
government for fighting for justice and freedom!!

Come and learn how you can join the international movement to free these
political prisoners!!

A reception will follow with FOOD This event is brought to you by The
Hispanic Scholarship Fund, LUCHA, ProLibertad and the Popular Education
Project to Free the Cuban 5

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5
http://www.freethecuban5.com
FreethecubanFIVE@...
Free the Cuban 5 Hotline: 718-601-4751

******************************************************************************

Download the April 2006 Edition of "Justice for the Five" the Project's
monthly newsletter:
http://www.freethecuban5.com/JF5April2006.pdf

*******************************************************************************

The Popular Education Project  to Free the Cuban 5 is calling on all freedom
loving people to support this new initiative to grant the families of the
Cuban 5 visas to visit them.

We have 121 Signatures; we need more!!  FORWARD THIS OUT AND INCREASE THE
NUMBERS!!  THE CUBAN 5 NEED US NOW MORE THAN EVER!!

The Popular Education Project to Free the Cuban 5 needs your help in
pressuring Louise Arbour, the High Commissioner of Human Rights of the
United Nations Office of Geneva, so she can request the U.S. government
grant visas to the family members of the Cuban 5.

We need you to sign the petition below and to mail out a letter to Luoise
Arbour!!

SIGN THE FOLLOWING PETITION:
http://www.petitiononline.com/Cuban5/petition.html

Download our letter to Louise Arbour and MAKE SURE TO MAIL IT TO THE ADDRESS
ON THE TOP OF THE LETTER.  MIALING IT IS IMPORTANT!! IT HELPS SHOW THAT
THERE MANY PEOPLE IN SUPPORT OF THIS CAMPAIGN:

http://www.freethecuban5.com/PEPLetterGeneva.pdf

PLEASE FORWARD THIS TO EVERYONE IN YOUR ADDRESS BOX!!  THE CUBAN 5 NEED US
TO BUILD THIS MASS MOVEMENT!!

*******************************************************************************

Cuba's Struggle Against U.S. Terrorism & the Freedom Fight of the Cuban 5
An evening with noted Cuban 5 Attorney Leonard Weinglass

Join us Thursday, April 20, for an exciting and informative evening
featuring Leonard Weinglass, renowned civil rights attorney and lawyer for
the Cuban 5.

Thursday, April 20, 7pm
Columbia Law School
Jerome L. Green Hall
435 West 116th St.
New York City

The Cuban Five political prisoners, who have already served seven and a half
years in U.S. prisons, due to their unjust convictions and sentences, had
their appeals heard in oral arguments before an "en banc" hearing, in the
11th Circuit Court of Appeals, on February 14. Weinglass will address the
legal issues in the appellate case.

The year 2006 will be crucial in the legal and political battle to win
freedom for these five men. Gerardo Hern�ndez, Antonio Guerrero, Ram�n
Laba�ino, Fernando Gonz�lez, and Ren� Gonz�lez are anti-terrorists activists
who were stopping terrorists from carrying out attacks on the island of
Cuba.

More information is available at http://www.freethefive.org
Sponsors: A.N.S.W.E.R. Coalition, National Lawyers Guild, National Committee
to Free the Cuban Five, Civil Rights Legal Society, the Popular Education
Project to Free the Five, Columbia University Black Students' Organization,
Columbia University Chicano Caucus.

*******************************************************************************

Tues. April 25th, 2006 5-7pm
FREEDOM NOW!! The Cases of the Puerto Rican and Cuban Political Prisoners

NYU Kimmel Student Center
60 Washington Sq South Room 805
(Btwn. Laguardia Place and Thompson)

DID YOU KNOW THAT THE U.S. GOVERNMENT WILL JAIL YOU FOR FIGHTING AGAINST
TERRORISM?

DID YOU KNOW PUERTO RICO HAS BEEN A COLONY FOR 107 YEARS?

Join us for an afternoon discussion on U.S.foreign policy with Cuba and
Puerto Rico. Also, learn about the Puerto Rican and Cuban political
prisoners!! These NINE REVOLUTIONARIES have been jailed by the U.S.
government for fighting for justice and freedom!!

Come and learn how you can join the international movement to free these
political prisoners!!

A reception will follow with FOOD This event is brought to you by The
Hispanic Scholarship Fund, LUCHA, ProLibertad and the Popular Education
Project to Free the Cuban 5
